title: Finland uses Facebook in Arabic to inform changed asylum policy
text:
Finland uses Facebook in Arabic to inform changed asylum policy 
Finland Times Saturday 24th October, 2015 
File Photo Lehtikuva. Finland has tried to use social media to tell potential refugees in the Middle East about tightened criteria applied in Finland. 
Head of the current events information unit at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs, Vesa Hakkinen, told a Finnish language newspaper Helsingin Sanomat that Facebook entries in Arabic language will convey the changes announced this week in eligibility for asylum in Finland. 
The target audience is Iraqi young men, both in Iraq and in Turkey.
